head.note: This manuscript record does not have associated contents as it is likely a composite manuscript. See the corresonding parts for a listing of its contents.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 5 distinct parts:

head.note: This manuscript contains: A Malkite Octôechus. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items. N.B., items have been renumbered by the editors and may not reflect Wright's original numeration.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

physDesc.p: Three vellum leaves, about 8 in. by 5 7/8, slightly stained and soiled. They belonged to a Malkite Octôechus, written in a good, regular hand of the xith cent., with 17 or 18 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: A good, regular hand of the xith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Hymns for the festivals of the whole year. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 16 items. N.B., items have been renumbered by the editors and may not reflect Wright's original numeration.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Hymns for the festivals of the whole year
msItem.quote: ܚܘܣ ܡܪܝ ܥܠ ܚܡܫ ܬܐܡ̈ܬܐ ܕܙܪܥ ܙܪܥܐ ܡܡܕܟ ܒܣ̈ܡܡܢܐ. ܒܐܪܥܐ ܕܚܝ̈ܘܬܐ. ܒܐܒܪܐ ܕܦܪ̈ܚܬܐ. ܒܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܡܪܝܐ. ܒܚܝܠܐ ܪܘܚܐ (read ܕܪܘܚܐ) ܩܕܝܫܐ. Then follow the words:ܒܪܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܪܗ̇ ܕܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ. ܚܘܣ ܥܠ ܟܬܘܒܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܐܝܟ ܓܝܣܐ ܒܙܩܝܦܐ.
msItem.finalRubric: ܠܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܘܠܩܘܠܣܐ ܘܠܗܕ[ܪܐ ܘܠܪܘܡܪܡܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ] ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܘܠܣܓܕܬܐ ܕܬܠܝܬ[ܝܘܬܐ ܡܫܒܚܬܐ ܘܫܘܝܬ] ܒܐܘܣܝܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܐܫܬ[ܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ] ܗܢܐ ܕܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ̣. ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܡܐ . . . ܘܬܫܥ̣. ܒܪܝܫܗ ܕܬܫܪܝܢ ܩܕܝܡ. ܗܢܘ ܕܝܢ ܪܝܫ ܫܢܬ[ܐ] . . . ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܛܝܣ. ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܡܩܪܝܣ. ــ ــ .ܥܒ̣ܕ ܕܝܢ ܝܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܕܢܬܟܬܒ ܐܒܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܘܣ[ܦ] ܪܝܫ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ̣. ܕܡܬܟܢܝܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܒܗ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܛܝܣ. ܐܝܟ ܕܠܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ.. ܟܬܒܗ ܕܝܢ ܐܢܫ ܡܚܝܠܐ̣. ܕܐܠܗܐ ܗܘ ܝ̇ܕܥ ܫܡܗ. ܐܠܐ ܐܘ ܚܒ[ܝܒܐ] ܕܩ̇ܪܐ. ܐܢ ܡ̇ܢ ܘܐܝܬ ܦܘܕܐ ܡܕܡ ܐ̇ܘ ܠܐ ܡܛܟܣܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: Part of what was written onfol. 25 bhas been erased, but at the foot of the page we find the well known formula quoted. Compare Assemani, Bibl. Apostol. Vatic. codd. MSS. Catal., t. iii., p. 75, cod. cix., where the form is:ܠܐ ܢܬܛܠܡ ܐܓܪܐ ܕܚܡܫ ܬܐܡ̈ܬܐ. ܕܥܡܠ ܙܪܥ ܙܪܥܐ ܡܡܕܟ ܒܥܩܪ̈ܐ. ܒܡܫܟܐ ܕܚܝܘܬܐ ܒܓ̈ܦܐ ܕܦܪܚܬܐ. ܨܠ̣ܘ ܥܠܝ ܐܚ̈ܝ ܕܐܬܚ̇ܢܢ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢܐ

On fol. 26 a there is a note in the same handwriting, stating that this hymn-book was written, in the year 11—9 in theconvent of Macariusin thedesert of Scete, by the order ofJoseph, abbat of theconvent of S. Mary Deipara.

listBibl.bibl: Assemani, Bibl. Apostol. Vatic. codd. MSS. Catal., t. iii., p. 75, cod. cix.
Land, Anecd. Syr., t. i., p. 58, t. ii., p.13; Journal of Sacred Literature for April 1863, p. 127.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 23 leaves (Add. 14,522, foll. 4—26), many of which are much stained and torn, especially foll.5, 10, 11, 19, 20, 22—26. Leaves are wanting at the beginning, and after foll. 11, 19 and 21. The quires are signed with letters (fol. 12, ܗ), and there are from 20 to 24 lines in each page. This manuscript is written in a good current hand, of the latter part of the ixth cent.

collation.p: The quires are signed with letters (fol. 12, ܗ).

item.p: 23 leaves (Add. 14,522, foll. 4—26), many of which are much stained and torn, especiallyfoll.5, 10, 11, 19, 20, 22—26. Leaves are wanting at the beginning, and afterfoll. 11, 19 and 21.

layout.p: There are from 20 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a good current hand, of the latter part of the ixth cent.
A later hand has added a note at the foot offol. 26a.

item.p: A later hand has added at the foot of the page

p.quote: ܕܠܚܐ ܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܢܗܘܐ ܚܪܡ ܡܢ ܐܒܐ [ܘܡܢ ܒܪܐ ܘ]ܡܢ ܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.

origin.origDate: This manuscript is written in a good current hand, of the latter part of the ixth cent. On fol. 26 a there is a note in the same handwriting, stating that this hymn-book was written, in the year 11—9. Owing to the leaf being torn, the precise date is uncertain, but the utmost limits necessarily are A. Gr. 1129, A.D. 818, and A. Gr. 1199, A.D. 888. The latter is probably very near the truth.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
